body:
This was added to improve performance on typical result sets. Are you saying you prefer to disable it for all queries?

https://book.cakephp.org/4/en/appendices/4-2-migration-guide.html#id3

> This was added to improve performance on typical result sets. Are you saying you prefer to disable it for all queries?
> 
> https://book.cakephp.org/4/en/appendices/4-2-migration-guide.html#id3

Yes !

Even small result sets are faster (at least) in my environment disabling client buffer ! 

And, in my very humble opinion, would be a nice option to advanced users who prefers to disable this 

**EDIT:**
A good example of better performance without client cursor is pagination of big and complex results

Well, if this does not have the desired effect, then we should consider reverting it.

Unfortunately, we've had no other feedback on this.

Please no ðŸ˜ž

I do not think reverting is the best way, just a flag for people like me that uses lots of varbinary and had problems with client cursors.
Well, we'd like to understand why you have such poor performance with small result sets.

> `Erro: SQLSTATE[IMSSP]: Memory limit of 50000 KB exceeded for buffered query`
> 
> Is there a way to disable Buffer on save() ?

I don't think so. I didn't expect that to be affected either.

We should definitely allow this to be disabled. For some reason, I thought it could be disabled with driver config, but we can look into it.

> Well, if this does not have the desired effect, then we should consider reverting it.
> 
> Unfortunately, we've had no other feedback on this.

Azure SQL Server without this option is useless. Very slow. Poor performance.
Please consider to not revert it : )
A flag should do the job : )
This issue is stale because it has been open for 120 days with no activity. Remove the `stale` label or comment or this will be closed in 15 days

I have this same issue here.
I am working on a project that saves files in SQL Server database, and get an error 
**SQLSTATE[IMSSP]: Memory limit of 10240 KB exceeded for buffered query**

when doing a SELECT in those tables

I am using cakephp/database 5.0.11

You need to increase the limit in php.ini. For example:

`client_buffer_max_kb_size='76800'`
`sqlsrv.ClientBufferMaxKBSize=76800`
`pdo_sqlsrv.client_buffer_max_kb_size=76800`
@ADmad Did your change to re-add disabling results buffering cover this?
This seems to be an issue at the pdo driver level. My changes which restored 4.x behavior only disable the buffering for the fetched results.
I followed the @celsowm suggestion and extended Sqlserver driver and remove the buffer line

Do we think this flag should be disabled by disableBufferedResults only?

Would that work for you?

> disableBufferedResults

Hi ! long time no see !

I have some suggestions:

A simple check on SqlServerDriver if [_config['flags']](https://book.cakephp.org/5/en/orm/database-basics.html#configuration) has something like:
`_config['flags'][PDO::SQLSRV_ATTR_CURSOR_SCROLL_TYPE]`
so the cakephp + sqlserver user can use/set it own type of cursor

edit: I tried a pull request !

edit2: by the way, **PDO::SQLSRV_CURSOR_FORWARD** is the default of **SQLSRV_ATTR_CURSOR_SCROLL_TYPE**

issue.body:
a simple check if PDO::SQLSRV_ATTR_CURSOR_SCROLL_TYPE was set as a pdo config flag or not
to solve this issue: https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/16848

issue.title: Fix client side buffering disabling for SqlServer.

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Don't set client side buffering flags when preparing PDO statement when it's disabled for the `SelectQuery`.

Fixes #16848.

This restores the behavior of 4.x.
